Mini Normal 1401 - Turn of the Century!

Moderator: Angry Pidgeon (Thats me!)
Reviewers: Cogito Ergo Sum, Llama Fluff, Empking

Rules - A.K.A. Read me or else.
Voting and Lynching
1. Votes must be either in bold Vote: Angry Pidgeon or vote tags VOTE: AP
2. A lynch will be reached when a majority of players are voting for someone
3. A No Lynch will be reached when half of the players are voting for "No Lynch"
4. If no majority happens by the end of the game Day, then no player will be lynched and night will begin

Posting and Communicating
1. After the lynch scene is posted, posting in the thread is forbidden until the next Day begins
2. No language other than English is to be used when posting
3. Editing or deleting of posts is forbidden
4. Use of text size, font, color or ANY other text styling to intentionally conceal or hide information is forbidden
5. One "bah" post is permitted if you die
6. Any out-of-game discussion is prohibited (unless specifically allowed by your role card)
7. Feel free to ask me for clarification on any rule at any time (I may decline to answer though)
8. No quoting of information from me in the thread (especially role cards)
8. My color is whatever the hell this color is; do not use it

Activity / Deadlines
1. Game Days will be 3 weeks long; game nights will be 3 days
2. Extensions to these may be granted depending on the circumstances
3. If you do not post in 72 hours, you will receive a PM prod; if you do not post 48 hours after such a prod, you will be replaced
4. You will be replaced if you would receive a 3rd prod
5. V/LA will exempt you from a prod


MISC
1. This is NOT a bastard mod game (any information I give you is truth)
2. Breaking any of the rules OR PRETENDING TO will result in a replacement, modkill, or possibly other action if I deem it necessary
3. Play to your Win Condition

Sample Vanilla Town Role PM. At least 1 player will receive this
Spoiler:
Why hello there, AngryPidgeon:

You are a Vanilla Townie

You have no special powers.

Win Condition: All players that are not town-aligned are dead and at least one town aligned player remains alive.

The game thread can be found here. Please respond via PM to confirm your role.

Role PMs going out shortly. Please confirm VIA PM. I will be sending out the PMs in player list order.

Role PMs have been all sent out. Day 1 will start when I have 10/13 confirmations PM'd back.

Day 1 has begun!

Not Voting: Kthxbye, Slandaar, Gorgon, theaceofspades, TheConman17, Mephistopheles, Huntress, Singer is Nachomamma, SaintKerrigan, qwints, Nobody Special, havingfitz, absta101

With 13 alive, it is 7 to kill kill murder stab.

Deadline: 11:59PM Pacific Time, Christmas Eve (December 24th).

That said, his last vote reads like a pretty scummy OMGUS vote, so he gets my vote for that. Truth to tell though, I often find it harder to read newbies than more seasoned players as they can be pretty erratic and don't confirm with norms of Mafia behavior - but a scumtell is a scumtell.

Kthxbye's wagon is getting stale anyway as he's been pretty active and seems to perform well under the voting pressure he's been under. It seems likelier and likelier that his stated eagerness to scumhunt was pretty genuine indeed.

Anyway, regarding SiN's supposed non-random vote, just saying that voting someone who hasn't written a word yet in the fourth player post in the game is non-random doesn't make it so. Unless you want to split hairs about what constitutes randomness. For instance, my own first vote was non-random in that I like the song Ace of Spades by Motörhead, and I quoted a line from it in my post. However, it certainly wasn't non-random in any meaningful game sense, and I don't see how SiN's could have been either.

But does it make him scummy to insist that it was and temporarily withhold the reason for it when asked about it? Not necessarily, although I question the value of this sort of gambit. They can easily create too much noise to be useful.

Setup:

Mafia goon

Town Mason
Town Mason
Odd Night Vig
Joat (1x Gunsmith, 1x Roleblock, 1x Vigilante)
6 Vanilla Town

So I really liked snifit's 1337 setup and this one was loosely inspired by that one. The Odd Night Vig and JoaT NKs were intended to create the illusion of an SK. The mason Gunsmith shot was intended to add to that too whilst being able to clear a vig claim. The mafia having only a BP and a goon in the group at first was to add to that illusion for the scumteam too. Although Slandaar ended up joining the QT at the end of N1 anyways .

I wanted the masons for a subversion of knowledge element that masons/ICs bring (alongside the illusion of an SK and the scumteam not knowing about the Traitor).

Mason/Mason/OddVig/JoaT were all fairly confirmable roles since the masons can claim relatively safely and the Vig/JoaT have an NK to 'prove' themselves. Masons and Vig shots don't gel super well (obviously), ESPECIALLY with a BP scum out there to eliminate 1/3 of the good Vig targets. The JoaT was intended to round out that slightly conflicting power with an RB (strong because it cant affect the masons, or even the Odd Vig on N2), a 1 shot investigate, and a 3rd way for the town to kill. I felt the extra vig shot was important because vig shots are only really effective when you can get 2 successful ones to achieve odds. (Or 1 and a block). So the extra vig shot gave 3ish potential vig shots so that the town could put itself at odds fairly reliably and get the full benefit of a vig entity despite the scum having a counter to it.

Originally I wanted the mafia goon to be a rolecop and one of the masons to ALSO be an odd night watcher. I also had the JoaT's RB as a 1xCommute originally.

The Mason/Watcher was deemed fairly non normal in review and turned to a regular mason. Also axed the Rolecop for balance at that point. But then it was decided the town was a little underpowered since mason/odd vig/(commute/gs/vig shot) didn't really flow together very well, so the commute was swapped for an RB that could also help control evens/odds and provided a moderately powerful shot without affecting any other town roles negatively. I was originally tickled by the benefit that the mafia rolecop role could get from finding the traitor for the mafia team before he would join the QT.
